Column Comment.0: SEISMIC SET SUBTYPE: The seismic set type column is used to enforce arelationship between the SEIS SET supertype and its valid sub types. Values for thiscolumn must be the name of the table that is the valid sub type for this row of data.Valid entries include SEIS_LINE, SEIS_SEGMENT, SEIS_SURVEY, SEIS_PLAN,SEIS_WELL, SEIS_PROC_SET, SEIS_INTERP_SET or SEIS_3D.
Column Comment.1: SEISMIC SET: A seismic set is a super type of various types of seismic collections.Valid types of seismic sets include SEIS_LINE, SEIS_3D, SEIS_SEGMENT andSEIS_SURVEY.
Column Comment.2: SEISMIC SET LICENSE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the approval granted toconduct seismic or geophysical operations.
Column Comment.3: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.4: APPLICATION ID: Unique identifier for applications you make for continuations,licenses etc. to the government.
Column Comment.5: DESCRIPTION: short narrative description of the license.
Column Comment.6: EFFECTIVE DATE: the date on which this row of data first came into effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.7: EXPIRY DATE: Date on which the data in this row of data was no longer in effect.
Column Comment.8: FEES PAID INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether the fees reuqired for thislicense or authorization have been paid.
Column Comment.9: GRANTED BY BUSINESS ASSOCIATE IDENTIFIER: the unique identifier for thebusiness associate, usually a regulatory agency, that grants this type of license.
Column Comment.10: GRANTED BY CONTACT ID: unique identifier for the person who is the contact forthe grantor of this license.
Column Comment.11: GRANTED DATE: the date that this license was granted.
Column Comment.12: GRANTED TO BA ID: the business associate that this license was granted to.
Column Comment.13: GRANTED TO CONTACT ID: unique identifier for the person who is the contact forthe grantee of this license.
Column Comment.14: LICENSE NUMBER: Reference number for the geophysical license as assigned bythe regulatory agency.
Column Comment.15: LICENSE TERM: The term for which this license will be in effect.
Column Comment.17: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.18: RATE and FEE SCHEDULE: A schedule for payments as set up by a businessassociate such as a service provider, jurisdiction or regulatory agency. Feeschedules are often used to administer the rates for rentals or for services provided.
Column Comment.19: RELATED SEISMIC LICENSE IDENTIFIER: Part of the FK for a related seismiclicense.
Column Comment.20: RELATED SEISMIC LICENSE SEISMIC SET IDENTIFIER: Part of the FK for arelated seismic license.
Column Comment.21: RELATED SEISMIC LICENSE SEISMIC SET SUBTYPE: Part of the FK for a relatedseismic license.
Column Comment.22: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.23: SECONDARY TERM: the secondary or extended term granted for this license.
Column Comment.25: SEISMIC LICENSE TYPE: The type of geophysical license that has been granted. Insome jurisdicitons a single license may be granted to cover all operations, in othersseperate licenses are granted based on the type of operation.
Column Comment.26: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.27: VIOLATION INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating that this license has been in violationof at least one requirement. Details are captured in the SEIS LICENSE FAIL table.
Column Comment.28: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.29: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.30: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.31: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.32: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.33: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.34: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
